me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.scoreboard

Class ScorelessBoardManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.scoreboard.ScorelessBoardManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBoardManager

    public abstract class ScorelessBoardManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a sidebar scoreboard manager which does not utilize Minecraft's score feature except for ordering. A different scoreboard wrapper is used for each player. Note that this class does not set any players to have its scoreboard, and implementers must do this. It is suggested that this be done via Player.setScoreboard(Scoreboard) in PlayerJoinEvent.

    Implementers of this class are expected to:

    • Create scoreboards using the factory methods provided by this class.
    • Display the scoreboards created by in some manner to players.
    • Override the appropriate abstract methods, including those required for scheduling and scoreboard entry generation.

    This class does not, by default, dispose of scoreboards at any point. The ticker will keep running even for players who are not online.

    Author:
    Glen Husman

      Deprecated. 
      This class will be replaced with a more vertasile system of dealing with duplicate values, rendering it pointless as SPACER_ENTRY can be used.

        public static final java.lang.String SPACER_ENTRY
        Represents a 16 character spacer string which can be used as a scoreboard entry. Duplicate values will be dealt with in the new system.

    • Method Detail

      • resetScoreboard

        public void resetScoreboard(Player player)
        Resets the scoreboard of the specified player, causing it to be recreated upon the next retrieval of that player's scoreboard. A call to this method does not, without subclass implementation, guarantee that the player will immediately see any change in scoreboard.
        Parameters:
        player - The player for whom to reset the scoreboard.

      • getScoreboard

        public final Scoreboard getScoreboard(Player player)
        Gets a scoreboard for the specified player. This method will return cached scoreboards if they exist, and create new ones if need be. Note that this method will only display proper information after the first invocation of the Runnables passed to schedule(Collection).
        Parameters:
        player - The player who will own the scoreboard.
        Returns:
        The scoreboard this manager owns for the specified player, or null if the player cannot be assigned a scoreboard.

      • schedule

        protected abstract void schedule(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Runnable> tasks)
        Schedules multiple tasks to run under a parent plugin. All tasks will be for scoreboard text cycling. This method may use any interval for the desired UI appearance, but the tasks must be repeating and executed on the main thread.
        Parameters:
        tasks - The tasks to schedule.

      • prepareScoreboard

        protected abstract ScoreboardInformation prepareScoreboard(Player player)
        Prepares a scoreboard for the specified player. Only called when a cached scoreboard is not available. To force a call to this method, resetScoreboard(Player) may be called.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who will own the scoreboard.
        Returns:
        A set of scoreboard entries that represents the player scoreboard. The iteration order of the collection containted in the returned object must represent the order of scoreboard entries, from top to bottom, to display to the player.
